titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 455
CWG14270

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 7

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, December 19th, 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 455 }
(Extract.)

33. Leave of absence for thirty days is hereby granted the following officers, (paroled Prisoners of War,) at the expiration of which they will report in person to the Commanding Officer of Camp Chase, Columbus, Ohio: --
1st Lieutenant M. P. Pulhain, 11th Kentucky Cavalry.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

p.hi:
OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

body.p:
11 Cavy
War Department
Adjutant Genl Office
Washington Dec 19. 1864
Townsend E D.
A. A. G.
Spe. Ord No. 455
Leave of absence for 30 days granted to
Lieut M. P. Pulhian 11" Ky. Cavy
Recd A. G. O. Decr 27, 1864
